comment: Minooie can be tough if you're not paying attention. But he offers so much extra credit that if you keep up with it, you'll be able to pad your grade. I failed both the midterm and the final, but due to the sheer amount of extra credit I did, I still managed an A. He's tough, but if you're smart about it, you'll be fine
Fantastic Professor! Prepare to work!

Literally do not listen to the negative reviews- if you are willing to put in effort, you will do just fine in the class. Minooie is a very nice guy, cares about the material and about his students. He's willing to help with anything, you just have to ask! Pay attention and participate in class/ discussions. Exams are hard but not weighted heavily.

For the love of God, do not listen to the negative reviews. They are written either by people who used AI and had to deal with the consequences, or who don't want to put any effort into the class. Dr. Minooie is the best professor I've had at KSU! He is a very caring, accessible, supportive, resourceful professor and wants his students to succeed.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Will do anything to make you fail. DO NOT USE AI. He will report you. I was falsely reported and now have to retake the class since he gave me a zero on all assignments. He never heard me out because this is simply how I write. This wasn't a personal attack, but he made it feel like one. 50+ required discussions. Used f-word 14x times in one class

Worst professor I've ever had. Will always criticize your work but never help you to be better in the class. Not to mention he is rude and demeaning in his criticisms. I really wish I had taken this class with a different professor. The group project was awful and if you don't have even one subject memorized, your'e going to fail this class badly.

Professor Minooie was definitely an interesting teacher. No matter how in depth your discussion posts were, there was always something he wanted you to add. He is extremely nice and will answer your emails at anytime if you have any questions but his grading system is terribly harsh. Make sure to watch EVERY lecture and take notes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
This is not a class you can breeze by. You have to put in effort, but that doesn't make it a bad class. I learned so much information that will be applicable in the future and also Professor Minooie was entertaining.

PARTICIPATE! It matters a lot. Also read the fine print, especially when it comes to the EITN project, the midterm, and the final.

Very caring and sarcastic professor. His course is a LOT of work, but everything is in the lectures. He requires a lot of work to be done in his class for you to succeed, and not putting 100% in throughout the course will make or break your grade. He provides good detailed feedback, but grades very harshly, especially in discussion posts.

This was probably the hardest course I have taken yet and I do feel like that is simply due to the professor alone. The assignments are extremely difficult and he is a tough grader who gives little to no feedback, making it very frustrating. After the final, I had to drop the class because there was no way I was going to pass.

Nice guy, funny, and engaging, but the course is difficult and has a fairly large course load. He is also not understanding of mental problems unless you have SDS accommodations. Don't take this class if you're going to skip the lectures are really important to the tests.

Very strict grader, discussion posts are more like essays, strict attendance policy. Hardest part were exams. 2 parts on each exam, test & paper, 4 days to complete. he expects you to spend min. 7 hours on writing the paper, not including studying and taking the test part, which is timed. If you enjoy law, he's good, if not, take someone else.

Horrible professor. Has security camera in classroom to monitor device use. Does not warn you about 12 hour midterm/final paper. Will do anything in his power to give you a low grade. Does not take feedback.

This professor, I kid you not, will do everything in his power to make sure you fail the class. He has unrealistic standards for his students. His grading criteria is extremely unclear and he will take off points for the simplest thing. I've had him twice before and every time he has been a PAIN. Please take my warning and DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!

I learned so many things from this class. I would leave feeling like I gained a lot of knowledge. He brings candy to "fight the monday blues". He is caring, and sassy, but he cares. However, there was so much work, and he was a super tough grader as well. He does add extra credit and wants everyone to succeed. Super stressful but needed.

I don't recommend taking him at all unless you want to stress about whether you're going to pass the class 24/7. He grades extremely hard for no reason. You could literally fulfill all the assignment requirements and he will still give you a failing grade. He can also get a bit sassy sometimes in his feedback.

Minooie is funny, helpful, gives good feedback, and cares about his students. He is a really tough grader, but you will do fine if you follow directions closely and pay attention to detail. He gives A LOT of homework and attendance is mandatory. Very hard class but he is over all a nice professor.

Professor Minooie is awesome! His lectures are very fun and engaging and we always have class discussions over very interesting topics! He gives lots of praise to all of his students for making an effort and even brings candy on Mondays! There are reviews claiming that he's vague and unhelpful but they're completely false. Take professor Minooie!

He is an unfairly tough grader. If you ask for help, he will be vague and not helpful whatsoever. I struggled exceptionally hard in this class and received multiple zeros for discussions due to not being through enough, even after asking for help and writing to the rubric. Beware!!!

Quizzes every other week they aren't hard if you pay attention. Tough grader and participation matters. Midterm with 2 parts, part 1 has 45 ques. and p2 has 6 questions with 2 parts to it so almost 12 questions and each needs an answer of a page long. I honestly don't recommend him as you will dread his class but if your interested then go for it.

It is very hard to understand this professor because of the way he chooses to explain and you could get distracted when you have a computer or social media getting your attention! After his class go back and listen to his lectures to do a great job on his discussions post, because he does not want you to repeat what others say.

Professor Milad Minooie is a extremely nice person. Professor M would let you stay over in his next class if you are having trouble in his class. this course is not lecture heavy. do all of the extra credit if your having trouble with your homework and classwork. participation matters. do the discussions post because it prepares for the midterm.
He's very nice kind of awkward just don't forget to talk to him and ask questions (you can never ask too much) he'll work with you where your at just don't try to take advantage of his help

I would take his class over and over and over again. Professor Minooie was the best professor I have had in all three years of college. While it is true that his workload is a little heavy, it will be enjoyable, especially if you have a major in the communication realm. He was very nice and very funny. I really enjoyed his lectures, too.

He is a fine professor but he is an exceptionally tough grader. He has tough projects due throughout the semester. He is picky on how they are completed and if they are not exact he will take points off. His class is very frustrating and takes time so do not take it unless you are willing to put in a large amount of work each week to this course.

Dr. Minooie is one of my favorite professors. He designs the class so even if you bomb the midterm you can still get a B. You'll have 3 question quizzes after every class, 2 discussions a week, a midterm, a final, and two easy assignments. He makes the class interesting and I decided to minor in POLS because of his lectures. Amazing guy.

Professor Minooie is a very nice man and he is very understanding however from a teaching aspect it is very hard to understand him. Attendance is mandatory and you have a discussion post due after every class. Participation matters heavily. Content is hard and the midterm is awful. If you like a heavy workload then this is the one for you :/
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Minooie is the best online prof. I've had. He clearly cares about his students and puts a lot of time into his class. He gives good feedback on assignments & discussions, has extra credit, his lectures are straightforward, and he answers emails quickly and in depth. A very nice guy. Overall, not a hard class. You'll get an A if you try.

Professor Minooie gives a decent amount of work that is due throughout the week, so schedule appropriately. For his summer class, we had 3 lessons each week followed by a 3 question quiz, which I found to be a bit tricky, and an application-based discussion which requires you to acknowledge your peers. He is so kind, knowledgeable and makes it fun!

Took online in the summer & Prof Minooie is the kindest prof I have ever had! He replies to emails very quickly and really cares about you. He wants us all to get an A but he makes you work for it! Although he required a lot of discussions and grades a little hard, it's for our own good. His toughness made me stronger in his class. Def take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: This class could be very difficult but he made it pretty easy & enjoyable. There are a ton of discussion posts that seem super hard at first but not too bad. His midterm was A LOT but hes a pretty lenient grader. Most of all, he listens to you and will work with you if you have any issues. He re-opened an assignment for me after I missed it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Minooie is one of the worst professor's I've taken. He has daily 3 question quizzes which don't make sense at all. The discussions are absurd and the way he explains topics don't make sense at all. The midterm and final didn't follow any of the content covered in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Minooie, is very difficult to follow threw in his lecture. Now how he grades is very odd you have to take 3 question quiz every day in the class but you won't know your grade until he grades your final exam, Now for the mid term and final exam are the same you take a test and a written portion, he grades it like a math equations and its confusing.

Dreaded going to this class everyday. He does not give clear grading criteria and grades very harshly. You have to participate either in class or online but he only gives you points if he thinks your comment contributed to the conversation. Hes not a terrible professor but he makes it very difficult to get an A. daily quizzes and discussions
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: this guy is so strict on participation , it's kind of absurd . asking a question doesn't count as participating in class , even if it starts a whole class discussion. your comment has to be related to the topic in class and nothing else. same for online participation . it just made it annoying to go to this class , at least for me
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: You really have to work for your grade in his course, as class participation is a must (you can speak up either online or in class). It is very difficult to make up for missed classes. He is a very understanding professor, and will work with his students though. Uses lots of practical examples when teaching, so you can easily apply the material!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Great person and hilarious, but a 'meh' professor. He speaks very softly and doesn't do a great job at explaining assignments so I typically felt a little lost. He's a bit of a tough grader, but he's fair and gives decent feedback. It's clear that he cares about his students though and he is passionate about the subject.

This class was not something I thought I would like. His class ended up being my favorite. He makes law and ethics interesting. You gain good friendships in his class through discussions and group presentations. Not quite an easy A because the midterm and final are challenging but it is possible to get an A in his class with minimal studying.

I am currently in his class and I hate it. He requires everyone to participate EVERY CLASS, and his lectures are SO boring. Hes a really sweet guy, but a little awkward. I do not advise taking him. Like 5 or 6 people took a W for his class cause they hated it so much.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters
